title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A woman explores different versions of her life through a mystical library.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through small changes.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance to control citizens.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A shepherd travels in search of treasure and discovers his personal legend.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A brief history of humankind from the Stone Age to the modern era.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl finds solace in books during Nazi Germany, narrated by Death.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins sets out on an epic journey to reclaim a treasure from a dragon.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield’s raw and honest take on adolescence and alienation.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert Kiyosaki
description: Lessons on wealth and financial independence through two father figures.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A prince becomes a messiah on a desert planet, fighting for control and survival.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A raw approach to living a meaningful life by embracing life’s struggles.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A man grapples with guilt after committing murder in search of meaning.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A guide to spiritual awakening through the practice of present moment awareness.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream through the eyes of Nick Carraway and his enigmatic neighbor Jay Gatsby.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard discovers his magical heritage and begins his journey at Hogwarts School.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, society, and first impressions in 19th century England.

title: The Kite Runner

description: A tale of friendship, guilt, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A Nobel laureate explores the two systems that drive the way we think and make decisions.

title: The Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Frodo Baggins embarks on a perilous quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The former First Lady shares her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A haunting vision of a totalitarian society where women are stripped of their rights.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teenagers with cancer fall in love and find meaning in their limited time together.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: A holistic approach to personal and professional effectiveness through character development.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A woman's quest for knowledge transforms her from survivalist family member to Cambridge PhD.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a hacker uncover corruption and violence in Sweden's elite circles.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist races to solve a murder that leads to religious conspiracies and ancient secrets.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A society where happiness is manufactured and individuality is suppressed through technology.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with treating a woman who refuses to speak after murdering her husband.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing

description: A young woman raised in isolation becomes the prime suspect in a murder case.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A marriage becomes the center of a twisted game when a wife disappears on their anniversary.

title: The Lean Startup

title: Life of Pi

description: A young man survives 227 days stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A girl volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death.

title: Ikigai

title: The Outsiders

description: A teenage boy navigates the divide between social classes in 1960s Oklahoma.

title: Mindset

description: How a simple idea about the brain can transform your approach to learning and success.

title: The Giver

description: A boy discovers the dark truth about his seemingly perfect society when he becomes the Receiver of Memory.

title: Steve Jobs

title: The Road

description: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic wasteland in search of safety.

title: Animal Farm

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks

title: The Four Agreements

author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use his ingenuity to survive until rescue arrives.

title: The Maze Runner

author: Dale Carnegie

description: Two teenagers with cancer fall in love and find meaning in their limited time together.

author: John Steinbeck

title: Twilight
